text: To install any of the mods
featured in this video,

use the download links
in the description below.
Also check out our video
on how to download Minecraft mods,
which is also linked in the description.

Biomes O' Plenty adds
over 19 unique biomes
that generate in your Minecraft world
and the Nether.
Along with these new biomes,
it adds new plants, trees, flowers,
building blocks, mobs, oars,
and much more.
These two mods together
completely overhaul Minecraft caves
by greatly enhancing the way they look,
as well as adding themed mine shafts.
Mine shafts are completely revamped

from straight lines into
dynamic varied webs of tunnels.

And mine shafts differ
from biome to biome.

You will also find new
cool underground structures
such as underground lakes and rivers,

as well as abandoned
workstations and dungeons.

Just Enough Items is an
item- and recipe-viewing mod.
This mod comes in handy,
as it gives you the crafting recipe

of pretty much every
craftable item in-game.
You can view the crafting recipes of items
by going into your inventory

and selecting an item from
the menu on the right.
This mod adds wearable backpacks
that can be very helpful.

The Traveler's Backpack
gives you extra space
to avoid having a full inventory.
You're also able to fill the backpack
with water and lava

and always have a supply
of both whenever needed.
The backpack also has a sleeping bag
that you can use

in case you need to
sleep while adventuring.
You also have a crafting table
available in your backpack.
Nature's Compass is a utility item
that gives you the ability
to find specific biomes more easily
by simply teleporting to them.
You can search for any biome
and view information about it.
This mod adds 49 new mobs to your game.

All of these mobs fall
into two categories,
real-world creatures such as grizzly bears
and road runners

or fictional creatures
such as the Endergrade
and warped frog.

All of these creatures
fulfill a necessary purpose
and have unique drops, mechanics,
and functions.
They also help make some environments
in the game feel more alive.

You can use the animal
dictionary you receive
once you join a new world
to view all the mobs added,

as well as learn more
about each one of them.

This mod adds a mini map to
the top left of your screen.
The mini map displays surrounding entities
including players, mobs, and items
as dots with a custom color or as icons.
You can also create waypoints
of certain locations in your world.

Waypoints help you find
previously visited locations
or reach specific coordinates
with optional teleportation.
Valhelsia Structures is a mod
that generates new structures
such as abandoned buildings, castles,
and dungeons.

These structures contain
various kinds of loot
and newly added blocks.
The Falling Tree mod makes the process
of chopping trees down much easier.
Instead of having to break each block
of a tree to chop it down,
with this mod,
all you need is an ax
to chop down the bottom block of a tree.
The tree will then fall down
along with all the wood on it,
making it much easier
to obtain wood, saplings, and apples.
